meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that certain glands produce secretins to help the body.
meanings.sent2: In biology class, we learned about the different types of secretins found in living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The secretins decided to have a party inside the body, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like secretins, spreading through the room and affecting everyone.
meanings.sent5: The secretins flowed through the bloodstream like tiny messengers of health.

meanings.definition: a type of protein involved in cell signaling
meanings.sent1: Researchers discovered a new secretins that plays a crucial role in cell communication.
meanings.sent2: The secretins in the cell membrane help transmit important signals for growth.
meanings.sent3: The secretins at the cellular party were the best communicators, always passing on the latest news.
meanings.sent4: His presence in the meeting was like a secretins, guiding the discussion in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The secretins acted as messengers, ensuring the cells knew when to grow and when to rest.

meanings.definition: a group of enzymes that aid in digestion
meanings.sent1: The secretins in the stomach break down food to make it easier to digest.
meanings.sent2: Digestive secretins work together to ensure nutrients are properly absorbed by the body.
meanings.sent3: The secretins in the kitchen were the chefs who knew exactly how to prepare the meal for digestion.
meanings.sent4: Her stomach growled, demanding more secretins to help with the digestion process.
meanings.sent5: The secretins in the intestines were like little helpers, ensuring everything was processed efficiently.
